name: Antarctica
description: Antarctica is the fifth-largest continent, covering about 14 million square kilometers (5.4 million square miles), mostly covered in ice. It is the coldest, windiest, and driest continent, with temperatures dropping as low as -80°C (-112°F). Antarctica is home to scientific research stations and unique wildlife such as penguins, seals, and whales.
borders: Borders with the Southern Ocean and is isolated from other continents by the Antarctic Circumpolar Current.
